## Elixir Logger: Compile-time Configuration Options

```APIDOC
Logger Compile-time Configuration:
  :always_evaluate_messages (boolean, default: false)
    Description: If messages should be evaluated even if the log level is lower than the minimum configured level. Useful for test environments to catch runtime errors in log messages.
  :compile_time_application (atom)
    Description: Sets the :application metadata value at compilation time. Automatically set by Mix.
  :compile_time_purge_matching (list of keyword lists)
    Description: Purges calls matching given conditions at compilation time, removing them completely to accrue no runtime overhead.
    Conditions:
      :level_lower_than (atom) - Purges messages with a lower logger level.
      :module (atom) - Purges messages with the matching module.
      :function (string) - Purges messages with the "function/arity" (e.g., "foo/3").
    Note: Dependencies must be recompiled for changes to take effect.
```

## Log Info Message in Elixir Logger

```Elixir
Logger.info("this is an info message")
```

## Log Info Message in Elixir Logger

```Elixir
# as keyword list
Logger.info([something: :reported, this: :info])

# as map
Logger.info(%{this: :info, something: :reported})
```

## Log Info Message in Elixir Logger

```Elixir
# as a keyword list
Logger.info("this is an info message", [user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"])

# as map
Logger.info("this is an info message", %{user_id: 42, request_id: "xU32kFa"})
```
